questions.question: A forceps delivery is being planned for a patient with prolonged second stage of labour.Which of the following is not a prerequisite for this procedure?
All of the following are criteria for the use of the following instrument except:

options.A: Fetal skull has reached pelvic floor
options.B: Fetal head is on the perineum
options.C: Scalp is visible at the introitus without separating the labia
options.D: Rotation of fetal head is more than 45 degrees

questions.explanation: The image shows Wrigley's forceps, which is a type of outlet forceps. Rotation of the fetal headshould not exceed 45 degrees for the application of outlet forceps. This is because it increases therisk of vaginal wall lacerations.

questions.question: 260Which of the following is true about instrumental vaginal delivery?

options.A: Full cervical dilatation is the only prerequisite
options.B: Forceps can be used for delivery of the after-coming head of breech
options.C: Ventouse cannot be used in rotational occipitotransverse/posterior delivery
options.D: Engaged head is not a prerequisite

questions.explanation: Forceps can be used for delivery of the aftercoming head of breech. The advantages are as follows:• Delivery can be controlled by giving pull directly on the head and the force is not transmittedthrough the neck.•Flexion is better maintained.• Mucus can be sucked out from the mouth more effectively.•Prerequisites for instrumental vaginal delivery:• Ruptured membranes vertex presentationCephalopelvic disproportion not suspected• No fetal coagulopathy or bone demineralization disorder• Completely dilated cervix•Precisely assessed fetal head position•Engaged head•Experienced operatorNote: Ventouse can be used for occipitotranverse or posterior position.

questions.question: A 25-year-old woman at 35 weeks of gestation is wheeled into the labour room following theonset of labor. A forceps delivery is planned for her. Which of the following is not acontraindication for this?
questions.explanation: Forceps can be used to deliver a preterm baby where it is believed to form a protective cage.Vacuum is contraindicated in these cases.Contraindications of forceps delivery:• Unengaged head266• Cephalopelvic disproportion•⚫ Malpresentations like brow and face (mentoposterior position)•⚫ Cervix not completely dilated•Inability to define position• Fetal coagulopathy or osteogenesis imperfectaNote: Forceps delivery is only reserved for mentoanterior position.

questions.question: What is the given device used for?
questions.explanation: The image shown is a vacuum delivery system. It is used for vacuum-assisted vaginal delivery ofthe fetus.Theoretical advantages of ventouse (vacuum extraction) compared to forceps include:•●Simpler requirements for positioning of the fetal head• Avoidance of space occupying blades within the vagina• Lower maternal trauma rates

questions.question: A 28-year-old G2P1 woman with a history of mitral valve prolapse was planned for ventousedelivery. Which statement is true regarding the mode of delivery planned for this patient?

options.A: Minor scalp abrasions and subgaleal hematomas in newborns are frequently seen
options.B: It can be applied when fetal head is above the level of ischial spine
options.C: Maternal trauma is seen more frequently when compared to forceps
options.D: It cannot be used when fetal head is not fully rotated

questions.explanation: Minor scalp abrasions and subgaleal hematomas in newborns are more frequently seen withventouse delivery than with forceps delivery.Maternal morbidity is seen more with forceps deliveries and perinatal morbidity is seen more withvacuum deliveries.Maternal morbidity seen in operative vaginal deliveries include:•Increased third and fourth-degree vaginal lacerations•Pelvic floor disorders• Postpartum hemorrhagePerinatal morbidity seen in operative vaginal deliveries include:• Vacuum-assisted perinatal injuries: Cephalohematoma, subgaleal hemorrhage, retinalhemorrhage, neonatal jaundice secondary to these hemorrhages, shoulder dystocia, clavicularfracture, intracranial hemorrhage, and scalp lacerations.• Forceps-assisted perinatal injuries: Higher rates of facial nerve injury, brachial plexus injury,depressed skull fracture, and corneal abrasion.In cardiac patients, vaginal delivery is preferred. It is conducted with the laboring woman in anupright or left decubitus position. Prophylactic use of vacuum is done to cut short the secondstage of labor. This is to minimize aortocaval compression. Caesarean section is not preferredsince it is associated with more blood loss and higher thromboembolic and infection risk.267

questions.question: Contraindications of ventouse include all except:
questions.explanation: Deep transverse arrest is an indication for ventouse delivery.In ventouse delivery technique, suction is created within a cup placed on the fetal scalp such thattraction on the cup aids fetal expulsion. The important step in ventouse extraction is proper cupplacement over the flexion point.The vacuum is gradually created by increasing the suction in increments of 0.2 kg/cm2 every 2minutes until a total negative pressure of 0.8 kg/cm2 is reached. Progressive descent shouldaccompany each traction attempt.

questions.question: You are an intern posted in the labor room assisting the delivery of a primigravida in labor.The obstetrician planned for a ventouse delivery because of maternal exhaustion. She askedyou to help place the ventouse cup. Where would you place it?

options.A: On the sagittal suture 3 cm in front of posterior fontanelle
options.B: On the sagittal suture 3 cm behind of anterior fontanelle
options.D: On the coronal suture 6 cm away from anterior fontanelle

questions.explanation: An important step in vacuum extraction is proper cup placement over the flexion point. It is apoint on the sagittal suture that lies 3 cm in front of the posterior fontanelle.Advantages of correct positioning of cup in vacuum extraction:• Maximum traction• Minimum cup detachment.Twisting of fetal head is avoided•Smallest head diameter is delivered through the pelvic outlet• Success rate is improved• Fetal scalp injury rates are lowered• Perineal trauma is reduced because the smallest fetal head diameter distends the vulva3 cm6 cmAFlexion pointOMARROWPosteriorfontanelleFlexionpointCupperimeterAnteriorfontanelle268

questions.question: A 24-year-old term primigravida was brought to the hospital in labor. Prophylactic ventousewas used due to ineffective expulsive efforts by the mother. What is the maximum negativepressure used in this procedure?262
questions.explanation: The maximum negative pressure used in ventouse is 0.8 kg/cm2Gradual vacuum creation is recommended. This is generated by increasing the suction inincrements of 0.2 kg/cm2 every 2 minutes. This is done until a total negative pressure of 0.8kg/cm2 is reached.This slow incremental approach would allow for a more firm attachment of the vacuum cup to thefetal head and thereby a lower failure rate.

questions.question: A prophylactic ventouse was planned for an anaemic pregnant woman. Delivery through thismode should occur within
questions.explanation: Delivery with ventouse should occur within 3 pulls over 15-20 min.

questions.question: A 24-year-old primigravida delivered a full-term male baby by assisted forceps delivery. Whatis not an advantage of this mode of delivery?

options.B: Quick in case of fetal distress

questions.explanation: Autorotation is seen with vacuum extraction and not assisted forceps delivery.Advantages of ventouse over forceps:• No need of anaesthesia• Less expertise required• Less maternal injuries• Promotes autorotation⚫ Does not occupy the sides•• Less traction force neededAdvantages of forceps over ventouse:• No maternal effort is needed•Quick in case of fetal distress• Can be used in face and breech• Can be used in preterm• Less cephalohematoma•Delivery failure is less

questions.question: What is the advantage of ventouse over forceps?

options.C: Can be used in preterm head

questions.explanation: The advantage of ventouse over forceps is that less expertise is required in this technique.Advantages of ventouse over forceps:269• No need of anaesthesia••• Less expertise required• Less maternal injuries• Promotes autorotation• Does not occupy the sides• Less traction force neededAdvantages of forceps over ventouse:●.• No maternal effort is needed• Quick in case of fetal distress• Can be used in face and breech• Can be used in preterm•Less cephalohematoma• Delivery failure is less

questions.question: 263During a routine check-up of a multigravida at 32 weeks of gestation, the fetus was found tobe in breech presentation. The obstetrician planned to do an external cephalic version. Whatis the ideal time to do this procedure?
questions.explanation: The ideal time to do external cephalic version is 37 weeks. This procedure is attempted in awoman who has completed 36 weeks of gestation and has a breech fetal presentation.Before 37 weeks, a breech presentation has a high likelihood of correcting spontaneously.Moreover, if performed too early, there is time to return back to breech.After 37 weeks, the success rates of ECV are very low. Although it can be performed until the earlystages of labour, it is not recommended.

questions.question: A 25-year-old multigravida at 36 weeks presents for routine ANC. On examination, a hard,ballotable structure is felt at the fundus. NST is reactive. The obstetrician performs thefollowing procedure on her. When will this procedure be contraindicated?
questions.explanation: The procedure shown here is external cephalic version. A relative contraindication for thisprocedure is intra-uterine growth restriction.

questions.question: At which angle would you perform a mediolateral episiotomy in a primigravida?
questions.explanation: The mediolateral episiotomy is directed at an angle of 60 degrees.The mediolateral episiotomy incision starts in the midline at the fourchette and is directed at anangle 60 degrees from the midline. This 60-degree angle takes into consideration a distortion ofperineal anatomy during crowning and ultimately yields an incision that is 45 degrees from themidline following delivery.270271
